regular.description: This is the typography style we use in small bodies of text, like caption, disclaimers, or small prints; we usually pair it with medium or low emphasis colors.

link.description: This is the typography style we use for hyperlinks in small bodies of text, like caption, disclaimers, or small prints; we usually pair it with link colors.

bold.description: This is the typography style we use to add great emphasis in small bodies of text, like caption, disclaimers, or small prints; we usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

semi_bold.description: This is the typography style we use to add moderate emphasis in small bodies of text, like caption, disclaimers, or small prints; we usually pair it with medium or high emphasis colors.

regular.description: This is the typography style we use in most of our bodies of text like paragraphs; we usually pair it with medium emphasis colors.

link.description: This is the typography style we use for hyperlinks in bodies of text, like paragraphs; we usually pair it with link colors.

bold.description: This is the typography style we use to add great emphasis in bodies of text, like paragraphs; we usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

semi_bold.description: This is the typography style we use to add moderate emphasis in bodies of text, like paragraphs, we usually pair it with medium or high emphasis colors.

regular.description: This is the typography style we use in most of our high emphasis bodies of text like introductory paragraphs after a heading; we usually pair it with medium emphasis colors.

link.description: This is the typography style we use for hyperlinks in bodies of text, like introductory paragraphs after a heading; we usually pair it with link colors.

bold.description: This is the typography style we use to add great emphasis in bodies of text, like introductory paragraphs after a heading; we usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

semi_bold.description: This is the typography style we use to add moderate emphasis in bodies of text, like introductory paragraphs after a heading; we usually pair it with medium or high emphasis colors.

bold.description:
We use this typography style for high emphasis headers nested on a 5th-6th level, h5's or h6's.
We usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

semi_bold.description:
We use this typography style for moderate emphasis headers nested on a 5th-6th level, h5's or h6's.
We usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

bold.description:
We use this typography style for high emphasis headers nested on a 4th level, h4's.
We usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

semi_bold.description:
We use this typography style for moderate emphasis headers nested on a 4th level, h4's.
We usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

bold.description:
We use this typography style for high emphasis headers nested on a 3rd level, h3's.
We usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

semi_bold.description:
We use this typography style for moderate emphasis headers nested on a 3rd level, h3's.
We usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

bold.description:
We use this typography style for high emphasis headers that are usually the main header of a page at a 1st-2nd level, h1's or h2's, since you can have a smaller or hidden h1 for SEO reasons.
We usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

semi_bold.description:
We use this typography style for moderate emphasis headers that are usually the main header of a page at a 1st-2nd level, h1's or h2's, since you can have a smaller or hidden h1 for SEO reasons.
We usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

bold.description:
We use this typography style for high emphasis headers that are usually display headers, like the main header of a landing page, at 1st-2nd levels, h1's or h2's, since you can have a smaller or hidden h1 for SEO reasons.
We usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

semi_bold.description:
We use this typography style for moderate emphasis headers that are usually display headers, like the main header of a landing page, at 1st-2nd levels, h1's or h2's, since you can have a smaller or hidden h1 for SEO reasons.
We usually pair it with high emphasis colors.We usually pair it with high emphasis colors.

overline.description:
We use this typography style for header's eyebrows, meaning a little text that go just above the header that can give more context on the header below.Eyebrows a re meant to be concise and not full sentences, if you need to give more context try using an subheading.

We usually pair it with low emphasis colors.

bold.description:
We use this typography style for high emphasis subheadings that go immediately below a heading, they usually there to give further context to the actual header.
We usually pair it with medium emphasis colors.

semi_bold.description:
We use this typography style for moderate emphasis subheadings that go immediately below a heading, they usually there to give further context to the actual header.
We usually pair it with medium emphasis colors.

regular.description:
We use this typography style for low emphasis subheadings that go immediately below a heading, they usually there to give further context to the actual header.
We usually pair it with medium emphasis colors.

disabled.description: The opacity we apply when a component is disabled.

height.description: The recommended height of medium-sized interactive components, for example buttons.

gap.description: The recommended gap between the content inside of a medium-sized interactive component.

horizontal.description: The recommended horizontal padding for medium-sized horizontal components.

height.description: The recommended size for small-sized interactive components. For example small buttons.

gap.description: The recommended gap between the content inside of a small-sized interactive component.

horizontal.description: The recommended horizontal padding for small-sized horizontal components.

border_radius.description: The recommended small border-radius for interactive component. Eg Buttons
The recommended large border-radius for interactive component. Eg Tags

border_width.description: The default border width for the edges of interactive components, like the ones on a tertiary(or outlined) button.
The default border width for the dividers within interactive components, like the ones on an action button.

border_radius.description: The recommended full border-radius for focus. Eg avatar
The recommended xlarge border-radius for focus. Eg toggle
The recommended large border-radius for focus. Eg segmented control
The recommended medium border-radius for focus. Eg check box
The recommended small border-radius for focus. Eg input control

border_width.description: The recommended width of the focus outline fo small-sized components, like the stars on a rating component.

border_radius.description: The recommended xsmall border-radius for focus. Eg icons
The recommended large border-radius for large containers, like modals.

padding.description: We uses this spacing as the default padding for large containers like modals.

gap.description: The recommended gap between items inside a large container, like a modal.

border_radius.description: The recommended small border-radius for containers. Eg in-line alert

gap.description: The recommended gap between items inside a container, like the gap between elements inisde a card.

horizontal_padding.description: The default padding of a small-sized container, like a tooltip.

vertical_padding.description: The default vertical padding of a small-sized container, like a tooltip.

min_height.description: The minimum height recommended for a small container, like a tag.

height.description: The average recommended height for a small container, like a tag.

border_radius.description: The recommended medium border-radius for containers. Eg cards

horizontal_padding.description: The default horizontal padding of a medium-sized container, like a card.

vertical_padding.description: The default vertical padding of a medium-sized container, like a tooltip.

min_height.description: The minimmum recommended height for a medium container, like a tag.

border_width.description: The recommended border width for the edges of containers, like cards or menus or popovers.
The recommended border width for the dividers within containers, like cards or menus or popovers.

border_radius.description: The recommended large border-radius for inputs
The recommended small border-radius for inputs
The recommended medium border-radius for inputs

padding.description: The default padding for inputs inside a form control.

gap.description: The default gap for between elements inside an input. For example, the space between a placeholder and an icon inside and input.

border_width.description: The recommended border width for the edges of text-based inputs, like textfields or text areas.
The recommended border width for the dividers within text-based inputs, like the textfields or textareas.

gap.description: The default gap for between elements inside a form field, like textfields, text areas.

box_shadow.description: The recommended box shadow for large containers, like modals or popovers.
The shadow we used for medium-sized components like elevated cards.
The shadow we used for small-sized components like tooltips.

size.description: This token is for dividers that are made with rectangles.
